item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 3, 2024 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Intel Launches Arc B-Series Graphics Cards (39 points | 1 comment)
2. The Tube Computer (7 points | 1 comment)
3. Skia Canvas: Browser-Less Implementation of the HTML Canvas Drawing API for Node (54 points | 23 comments)
4. Christopher Hitchens and the Necessity of Universalism (11 points | discuss)
5. Tweaking Stunt Island's 30-year-old 3D Engine (129 points | 31 comments)
6. We switched from Next.js to Astro (and why it might interest you) (56 points | 21 comments)
7. Launch HN: Vocera (YC F24) – Testing and Observability for Voice AI (26 points | 12 comments)
8. TOC MyTimeMachine: Personalized Facial Age Transformation (8 points | discuss)
9. Broadcom loses another big VMware customer (116 points | 80 comments)
10. Stack Auth (YC S24), open-source Auth0 alternative, is hiring Founding SWEs ( | hide)
11. Amazon Nova (42 points | 14 comments)
12. Lessons I learned working at an art gallery (365 points | 150 comments)
13. My Brand New Digitizing Workflow Using a 25 Year Old Film Scanner (12 points | 4 comments)
14. South Korean president declares martial law, parliament votes to lift it (407 points | 442 comments)
15. USC Student Rocket Group Shatters International Amateur Space Record (199 points | 176 comments)
16. On-scalp printing of personalized electroencephalography e-tattoos (13 points | discuss)
17. Show HN: Simtown: A 2D Role-Playing Game Where Characters Talk, Move, and Act (8 points | 1 comment)
18. California teacher dies from suspected rabid bat bite (21 points | 28 comments)
19. MTA's A.I. bus cameras issue mistaken parking violations (24 points | 18 comments)
20. 'I'm running a Mud so I can learn C programming ' (1993) (70 points | 54 comments)
21. Rust in QEMU Roadmap (190 points | 90 comments)
22. Vintage digicams aren't just a fad. They're an artistic statement (77 points | 154 comments)
23. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (December 2024) (346 points | 326 comments)
24. Show HN: Copper – Open-source robotics in Rust with deterministic log replay (152 points | 33 comments)
25. Distributed Erlang (153 points | 53 comments)
26. FTC Bans Location Data Company That Powers the Surveillance Ecosystem (18 points | 2 comments)
27. Fish have a brain microbiome – could humans have one too? (316 points | 122 comments)
28. The Last Viridian Note (2008) (16 points | 9 comments)
29. An English castle became a stork magnet (61 points | 14 comments)
30. World Labs: Generate 3D worlds from a single image (447 points | 131 comments)
